content:
I just replied to the campaign email with the subject line "Please reply to this email" asking for feedback on the campaign, & got an undelivered bounceback that says "the domain contact.kamalaharris.org couldn't be found"  My reply to the email went to     info@contact.kamalaharris.org

Can someone inform the right team that this is happening?

Hmm, Thanks, <@1278144299678171250> for pointing this out. I am not sure about that email address and I am going to ask staff and will follow up on this. To give feedback, I know you can use: https://democrats.org/contact-us/

Thanks for the reply Claire. Here's the info at the bottom of the bounceback if it helps: The response was:

DNS Error: DNS type 'mx' lookup of contact.kamalaharris.org responded with code NXDOMAIN Domain name not found: contact.kamalaharris.org For more information, go to https://support.google.com/mail/?p=BadRcptDomain
I can jump on a screenshare call to show what I got if it helps.
Hi <@1278144299678171250> ! Was the email you tried to send to contact@kamalaharris.org?

The email I received shows that it was from contact@e.kamalaharris.com. When I replied to it, it shows that it went to     info@contact.kamalaharris.org, which is different from the email address it came from. All I did was hit Reply, so I'm not sure why it defaulted to a different email address, but I imagine this is happening to everyone.
I can copy/paste my reply and just email it to a different email address.

Oh I see. It is likely that the contact@e.kamalaharris.com email can send out emails but the inbox can't receive replies, and the original senders changed the reply-to email so they could see the replies that came in from that feedback request. I hope that helps clear things up!
But that doesn't solve for my reply getting a bounceback and not going through.
Are you saying that my reply was received and can be seen by the staff?
I thought your reply went to info@contact.kamalaharris.org?

It did, but the bounceback I got says: "Your message wasn't delivered to info@contact.kamalaharris.org because the domain contact.kamalaharris.org couldn't be found. Check for typos or unnecessary spaces and try again."
something is buggy, because the domain, contact.kamalaharris.org should be recognized, and it's saying that it's not recognized.
Okay I sent it to that email. Thank you

I had the same thing happen. Which means it is happening to everyone who was sent this email by the campaign. A correction email might need to be sent out with the correct response email as it effects all supporters, not just volunteers.

(taking off mod hat) Yes, absolutely, they could send out and 'oops, let's try this again email' with the right reply-to address. I know other ways to contact the campaign, but a lot of people may have been annoyed by this.
